actions.name: AddTags
actions.description: Adds the specified tags to the specified load balancer. Each load balancer can have a maximum of 10 tags

actions.name: ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
actions.description: Associates one or more security groups with your load balancer in a virtual private cloud (VPC)

actions.name: AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets
actions.description: Adds one or more subnets to the set of configured subnets for the specified load balancer

actions.name: ConfigureHealthCheck
actions.description: Specifies the health check settings to use when evaluating the health state of your back-end instances

actions.name: CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy
actions.description: Generates a stickiness policy with sticky session lifetimes that follow that of an application-generated cookie

actions.name: CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy
actions.description: Generates a stickiness policy with sticky session lifetimes controlled by the lifetime of the browser (user-agent) or a specified expiration period

actions.name: CreateLoadBalancer
actions.description: Creates a load balancer

actions.name: CreateLoadBalancerListeners
actions.description: Creates one or more listeners for the specified load balancer

actions.name: CreateLoadBalancerPolicy
actions.description: Creates a policy with the specified attributes for the specified load balancer

actions.name: DeleteLoadBalancer
actions.description: Deletes the specified load balancer

actions.name: DeleteLoadBalancerListeners
actions.description: Deletes the specified listeners from the specified load balancer

actions.name: DeleteLoadBalancerPolicy
actions.description: Deletes the specified policy from the specified load balancer. This policy must not be enabled for any listeners

actions.name: DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer
actions.description: Deregisters the specified instances from the specified load balancer

actions.name: DescribeInstanceHealth
actions.description: Describes the state of the specified instances with respect to the specified load balancer

actions.name: DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes
actions.description: Describes the attributes for the specified load balancer

actions.name: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicies
actions.description: Describes the specified policies

actions.name: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes
actions.description: Describes the specified load balancer policy types

actions.name: DescribeLoadBalancers
actions.description: Describes the specified the load balancers. If no load balancers are specified, the call describes all of your load balancers

actions.name: DescribeTags
actions.description: Describes the tags associated with the specified load balancers

actions.name: DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
actions.description: Removes the specified subnets from the set of configured subnets for the load balancer

actions.name: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
actions.description: Removes the specified Availability Zones from the set of Availability Zones for the specified load balancer

actions.name: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
actions.description: Adds the specified Availability Zones to the set of Availability Zones for the specified load balancer

actions.name: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
actions.description: Modifies the attributes of the specified load balancer

actions.name: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
actions.description: Adds the specified instances to the specified load balancer

actions.name: RemoveTags
actions.description: Removes one or more tags from the specified load balancer

actions.name: SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate
actions.description: Sets the certificate that terminates the specified listener's SSL connections

actions.name: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
actions.description: Replaces the set of policies associated with the specified port on which the back-end server is listening with a new set of policies

actions.name: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
actions.description: Replaces the current set of policies for the specified load balancer port with the specified set of policies
